criteria.criterion: Weight-bearing X-rays must be completed within 60 days
Physical therapy must be attempted and documented (minimum 6 weeks)
Clinical notes must be within 30 days
Patient must have a valid clinical indication: meniscal tear, positive mcmurray, red flag, post-operative
Evidence must be validated with no hallucinations

imaging.findings: moderate to severe medial compartment joint space narrowing

functional_impairment.description: significant functional limitations, unable to climb stairs without handrail and assistance, cannot ambulate >1 block without stopping for pain

evidence_notes: Bilateral knee pain, right greater than left, x 7 months
Right knee pain began approximately 7 months ago
Medial knee pain rated 6/10 with ambulation

prerequisites: Creatinine / eGFR within 6 months of imaging
documentation_requirements: Complete labs (CBC with diff, ESR, CRP, blood cultures, synovial fluid results)
